alert.note: Alert for Butler; Colfax; Platte (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 6:20PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Colfax, eastern Platte and northwestern Butler Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 620 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles south of Columbus, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Columbus around 630 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Leigh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northeastern and east central Nebraska.
